node_1.locution: Melanie : you famously welcomed the Occupy protesters to St Paul’s Cathedral
node_1.proposition: you famously welcomed the Occupy protesters to St Paul’s Cathedral

node_2.locution: Boudewijn : my theory is that trust not only requires moral integrity, but also competence
node_2.proposition: my theory is that trust not only requires moral integrity, but also competence

node_1.locution: Clifford :  Now, if that’s the case, isn’t it inevitable that the essential immorality of business will infect the way individuals behave who work for it?
node_1.proposition: it is inevitable that the essential immorality of business will infect the way individuals behave who work for it

node_2.locution: Clifford : I’m talking about the essential shell of a company that it is actually essentially amoral. It’s not a person is it, in the sense that you and I are. It doesn’t have a conscience; it can’t be shamed can it? Now, isn’t that morality bound to affect the way people behave who work for it?
